SEARCH
Package entities

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
entities.Entity
entities.Enemy
Direct Known Subclasses:
Crabby
public abstract class Enemy extends Entity
The Enemy class represents a generic enemy in the game. It defines common behavior, attributes, and interactions for all enemies.

    • Enemy

      public Enemy(float x, float y, int width, int height, int enemyType)
      Constructs a new Enemy instance with the specified position and dimensions.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the enemy's position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the enemy's position.
      width - The width of the enemy.
      height - The height of the enemy.
      enemyType - The type of the enemy.

    • canSeePlayer

      protected boolean canSeePlayer(int[][] lvlData, Player player)
      Checks if the enemy can see the player based on their positions and level data.
      Parameters:
      lvlData - The level data for the current level.
      player - The player instance.
      Returns:
      true if the enemy can see the player, false otherwise.
